replies.msg:
《要求署理學務長周敬流教授立即下台》
周教授任職署理學務長兩年，其惡政人人皆知，在此略數一二：
1、校方打壓學生活動
2、校方審查大紙報牆
3、校方取消暑期宿位
4、校方未有兌現承諾跟進之事宜
5、校方漠視廣泛科大民意

校方種種刻意阻撓，目的要令學子及學生組織失去應有權利，屈服在科大校方獨裁之下。學生應有的自由和權益面對重大危機，學生自主之名亦將蕩然無存，署理學務長周敬流教授必須為此負上最大責任引咎辭職。

原文: https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=3514252815256202&set=a.288100644538118

Dear the head of division of Life Science,
This is a formal request for grade review of LIFS1030 from student XXX (XXXXXXXX). Referring to the university’s grading policy, students may submit a request form to the head of department involved if the remaining concern unsolved. This request letter is divided into three sections as suggested by the university, including “I stating the grounds for the request for review”, “II Describing the relevant facts”, and “III Providing supporting evidence”.

I. Stating the grounds for the request for review
On 27 May, the exam schedule had been delayed around 30minutes due to the host’s technical issue without any prior notification. It was not the first time for this delay, the same situation occurred during mid-term exam as well. Not to mention the mental pressure we have to suffer, but also many uncertainties we may encounter. For instance, some students have their upcoming exams just after the LIFS1030 exam.
On 12 June, the grade was released in student center without disclosure of marks for both mid-term exam and final exam. From the UST Space Forum, many students also expressed out of expectation to the grade. However, the zero transparency for this course has extremely affected ourselves to judge the grade. The fact that a large portion of students felt disappointed to the grade and the insufficient information disclosed, being the major causes of this request for grade review.

II. Describing the relevant facts
As seen on the canvas, it has stirred up much controversy about the arrangement of final exam (attachment1). For me, I felt hopeless when I was unable to enter the zoom meeting for exam, especially there was no reply when I inform this situation. It is not my own problem, at least more than 60 students encountered the same problem. Besides, the course didn’t release any score and then come up with a grade shown on student center. Such zero transparency aroused a doubt about the calculation of the grade and the fairness of exam.

III. Providing support evidence
Attachment 1 (Canvas Discussion)
Attachment 2 (Canvas grade)
